gameObjective.title: Game Objective :
gameObjective.description: Be the first to have enough good practices to save at least 1T (1000kg) of CO2 through Green IT practices. If you are in a hurry, you can set a new goal (600kg or 800kg).

gamePreparation.title: Game Preparation :
steps: The first player is chosen by drawing lots

turnSequence.title: Turn Sequence :
turnSequence.description: The game begins with a multiple-choice awareness question for all players. A correct answer allows the player to start playing. An incorrect answer blocks the player until they answer correctly.
turnSequence.playerActions: On their turn, the player can play one of the following cards or discard a card if it is impossible to play:

cardAnatomyTitle: Anatomy of a Good Practice Card :

goodPracticeCards.title: Good Practice Cards :
goodPracticeCards.description: These cards present practices to be implemented in the work environment that are more environmentally friendly. To win, the player must save a certain number of kg of CO2 that the game master defines at the beginning of the game. When a player plays this card, they can choose whether this practice is applicable in their daily life. If so, they can find it in their Green IT notebook.

badPracticeCards.title: Bad Practice Cards :
badPracticeCards.description: Bad practice cards are played to block another user. They will have to play a training or expert card to unblock themselves and be able to play good practice cards again. To play it, the selected player must not already be under the influence of a bad practice.

trainingCards.title: Training Cards :
trainingCards.description: If a player is blocked by a bad practice card, they can free themselves with a training card of the same nature. They can find their training in their Green IT notebook at the end of the game.

awarenessPoints.title: Awareness Points :
awarenessPoints.description: At the end of each turn, an awareness multiple-choice questionnaire appears. Players have 15 seconds to answer and accumulate awareness points for a correct response. If the player is blocked by a bad practice card, they can use 1 point to draw a training card or 3 points to draw the correct training card that allows them to unblock themselves.

expertCards.title: Expert Cards :
expertCards.description: Playing an expert card allows countering a bad practice card of the same nature or protecting against upcoming bad practice cards.
